titleStmt.title: The declaration of the Lords and Commons assembled in the Parliament of England, to the subjects of Scotland With His Maiesties message to the Lords of His Privy Counsell of Scotland, upon that occasion. Charles R. Our expresse pleasure is, that this our declaration be published in all churches and chappels within our kingdome of England and dominion of Wales, by the parsons, vicars or curates of the same.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

publicationStmt.publisher: by Leonard Lichfield printer to the Vniversity,
publicationStmt.pubPlace: Printed, by his Majesties command, at Oxford :

notesStmt.note: A declaration by Parliament of Nov. 7, 1642, asking Scotland to aid it by raising forces to suppress "the army of Papists and forreiners" along with the King's Message to the Privy Council of Scotland, requiring them to take no notice of the declaration.--Madan.
Dated at end: the sixth day of December. 1642.
In this edition, line 3 of title reads: of the Lords and.
Reproductions of originals in: Thomason Collection, British Library; Folger Shakespeare Library.
